itemListElement.name: Soft Whole Wheat Dinner Rolls with Tanzhong starter

@graph.name: Soft Whole Wheat Dinner Rolls with Tangzhong Starter
@graph.description: Soft Whole Wheat Dinner Rolls. Moist and soft Whole wheat Rolls 100% Whole grain rolls. Use as Wheat Buns for Burgers or Sliders. Vegan Whole Grain Dinner Rolls. Soy-free Palm Oil-free Recipe. Makes an 8 by 8 or 9 by 9 inch square pan.
recipeIngredient: 1/4  scant cup whole wheat flour (a bit less than 1/4 cup)
2.5 tbsp maple syrup or other sweetener of choice (i like to use 1.5 tbs mapel and 1 tbsp sugar)
2 cups whole wheat flour (or 1 cup whole wheat and 1 cup whole spelt flour)
1/4 tsp almond extract (optional, adds nice bakery like smell)
olive oil or vegan butter for brushing

recipeInstructions.text: In a small saucepan combine 1/4 cup flour and 1/2 cup water over medium heat. mix well and cook until gel like, smooth and starting to get shiny, stirring frequently. Set this tangzhong starter lump aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small saucepan combine 1/4 cup flour and 1/2 cup water over medium heat. mix well and cook until gel like, smooth and starting to get shiny, stirring frequently. Set this tangzhong starter lump aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the ingredients under Sponge in a bowl. Mix with a large spoon for 2 minutes until the batter is very smooth and starting to get gluten-ny.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the ingredients under Sponge in a bowl. Mix with a large spoon for 2 minutes until the batter is very smooth and starting to get gluten-ny.

recipeInstructions.text: Let the bowl sit covered for 1 hour in a warm place. (Use a large bowl as the sponge will triple).
recipeInstructions.name: Let the bowl sit covered for 1 hour in a warm place. (Use a large bowl as the sponge will triple).

recipeInstructions.text: In a stand mixer, add the sponge, tangzhong. Mix the salt into the 2 cups flour and add the flour to the stand mixer. Start kneading. Add in the oil, lemon juice and continue to knead for 5 minutes. Let the dough rest for 2 minutes. Check the dough to see if it needs more flour or water (it should be soft and smooth. not stiff and not sticky). Add more flour 1 tbsp at a time if needed. The dough should be soft and slightly tacky, but not overly sticky or not too stiff.
recipeInstructions.name: In a stand mixer, add the sponge, tangzhong. Mix the salt into the 2 cups flour and add the flour to the stand mixer. Start kneading. Add in the oil, lemon juice and continue to knead for 5 minutes. Let the dough rest for 2 minutes. Check the dough to see if it needs more flour or water (it should be soft and smooth. not stiff and not sticky). Add more flour 1 tbsp at a time if needed. The dough should be soft and slightly tacky, but not overly sticky or not too stiff.

recipeInstructions.text: Knead for another 5 to 7 minutes. The dough should not break immediately when a small portion is pulled out. (I knead at setting 2 on my kitchen aid). You can let the dough rest for 15-20 minutes at this point.
recipeInstructions.name: Knead for another 5 to 7 minutes. The dough should not break immediately when a small portion is pulled out. (I knead at setting 2 on my kitchen aid). You can let the dough rest for 15-20 minutes at this point.

recipeInstructions.text: Divide the dough in 12 equal balls. flatten each ball into an oval then roll it up like a jelly roll. Place seam side down in the baking pan. Repeat for all rolls. Spray oil on top. Sprinkle sesame seeds or oats. * See Notes for refrigeration or freezing instructions.
recipeInstructions.name: Divide the dough in 12 equal balls. flatten each ball into an oval then roll it up like a jelly roll. Place seam side down in the baking pan. Repeat for all rolls. Spray oil on top. Sprinkle sesame seeds or oats. * See Notes for refrigeration or freezing instructions.

recipeInstructions.text: Cover the pan with a towel and let rise for 25 to 40 minutes or until the rolls double in size.
recipeInstructions.name: Cover the pan with a towel and let rise for 25 to 40 minutes or until the rolls double in size.

recipeInstructions.text: Pre-heat the oven to 375 degrees F/ 190ºc. Bake the bread for 20 to 22 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Pre-heat the oven to 375 degrees F/ 190ºc. Bake the bread for 20 to 22 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the pan from the oven and brush oil or vegan butter on top. Remove the bread from the pan after 10 minutes. Wait for another 5 before serving the warm rolls with olive oil or vegan butter or as a side with anything.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove the pan from the oven and brush oil or vegan butter on top. Remove the bread from the pan after 10 minutes. Wait for another 5 before serving the warm rolls with olive oil or vegan butter or as a side with anything.

recipeInstructions.text: Store in a bread container on the counter for upto 2 days or refrigerate for upto a week.
recipeInstructions.name: Store in a bread container on the counter for upto 2 days or refrigerate for upto a week.
